pr_title: Refactor all geo scalars to new function registry

timeline.author: kovrus

timeline.bodyText:
what is the preferable way of defining the signature
parseTypeSignature("double precision")

or
DataTypes.DOUBLE.getTypeSignature()

?
timeline.author: kovrus

replies.bodyText: No strict preference, both is valid. I prefer parseTypeSignature("double precision") as I think is more readable, but may be just a personal preference.
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText: Wouldn't the second variant be safer, since the type name must be valid to create the DataType instance later on?
replies.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: parseTypeSignature() will also fail on invalid types as it will call DataTypes.ofName() eventually.
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText:
parseTypeSignature() will also fail on invalid types as it will call DataTypes.ofName() eventually.

Good point, although I think DataTypes.DOUBLE.getTypeSignature()  or parseTypeSignature(DataTypes.DOUBLE.getName())  would make the relationship clearer and make refactorings easier.
Probably not worth going through all open PRs again, but maybe going forward?
replies.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: Refactoring is a good point although I really like the literal variant. But yes lets use then DataTypes.DOUBLE.getTypeSignature() in future.
replies.author: seut
